charts.name: Total Potential Monthly Savings from RIs

sources.sourceDescription: The aws.instance.price metric reports the hourly On Demand price for each running On Demand instance
sources.name: price

sources.sourceDescription: count the number of instances of each type by region. ${estimation} is chosen by the strategy Dashboard Variable (E.g. the minimum number over the past month)
sources.name: instance-count

sources.sourceDescription: For each instanceType in each Region find the difference between the on demand price and the effective hourly price of a reservation made using the options specified by the Dashboard Variables
sources.name: savings-per-instance

sources.sourceDescription: Calculate the total savings per month if all instances were reserved
sources.name: savings-per-month

charts.name: Potential Savings from RIs by Instance Type

sources.sourceDescription: The aws.instance.price metric reports the hourly On Demand price for each running On Demand instance
sources.name: price

sources.sourceDescription: count the number of instances of each type by region. ${estimation} is chosen by the strategy Dashboard Variable (E.g. the minimum number over the past month)
sources.name: instance-count

sources.sourceDescription: For each instanceType in each Region find the difference between the on demand price and the effective hourly price of a reservation made using the options specified by the Dashboard Variables
sources.name: savings-per-instance

sources.sourceDescription: Calculate the total savings per month if all instances were reserved
sources.name: savings-per-month

charts.name: Suggested Number of Reservations
charts.description: The Estimation Approach dashboard variable controls the behavior of this chart. For example if set to "Conservative - Min", it will display the minimum number of instances of each type that were running at any given time over the past 1 month (with the assumption being that you should reserve at least that many).

sources.name: Suggested number of reservations
sources.query: ${estimation}(${window}, count(align(1m, ts(aws.instance.price, accountId=${account_id} and Region="*" and instanceLifecycle=normal)), instanceType, Region))

sources.name: Billing Cost breakdown
sources.query: avg(align(1m, mean, last(12h, ts(aws.billing.estimatedcharges and not source=usd and accountId=${account_id}))), ServiceName, Currency, accountId)

charts.name: General Purpose
charts.description: Shows the number of T2, M3 or M4 instances running. If there is No Data it means there are no instances of those types.

sources.name: No. of Instances
sources.query: count(align(1m, mean, ts(aws.instance.price, accountId=${account_id} and (instanceType="m*" or instanceType="t*"))),instanceType)

charts.name: Compute Optimized
charts.description: Shows the number of C3 or C4 instances running. If there is No Data it means there are no instances of those types.

sources.name: No. of Instances
sources.query: count(align(1m, mean, ts(aws.instance.price, accountId=${account_id} and instanceType="c*")),instanceType)

charts.name: Memory Optimized
charts.description: Shows the number of R3, R4 or X1 instances running. If there is No Data it means there are no instances of those types.

sources.name: No. of Instances
sources.query: count(align(1m, mean, ts(aws.instance.price, accountId=${account_id} and (instanceType="x*" or instanceType="r*"))),instanceType)

charts.name: Accelerated Computing Instances
charts.description: Shows the number of P2, G2 or F1 instances running. If there is No Data it means there are no instances of those types.

sources.name: No. of Instances
sources.query: count(align(1m, mean, ts(aws.instance.price, accountId=${account_id} and (instanceType="p*" or instanceType="g*" or instanceType="f*"))),instanceType)

charts.name: Storage Optimized
charts.description: Shows the number of I3 or D2 instances running. If there is No Data it means there are no instances of those types.

sources.name: No. of Instances
sources.query: count(align(1m, mean, ts(aws.instance.price, accountId=${account_id} and (instanceType="i*" or instanceType="d*"))),instanceType)

charts.name: TB of EBS Allocated
charts.description: Shows the total size of your EBS volumes. If there are no volumes this chart will show No Data.

charts.name: Number of Reserved Instances
charts.description: Shows the number of reserved instances by instance type. This chart will show No Data if there are no reservations in the selected AWS account.

charts.name: Current Savings from RIs
charts.description: Predicts the savings you will get from the current reservations in the selected AWS Account

sources.sourceDescription: aws.reservedInstance.count is a metric which reports the number of instances in each region. It has tags for instanceType, Region and AvailabilityZone (among others). Here we are interested in how many instances of each type have been reserved in each Region so we sum the metric grouping by those tags. Uses taggify to assume the operatingSystem is Linux
sources.name: reservations
sources.query: taggify(sum(align(5m, mean, ts(aws.reservedInstance.count)), instanceType, Region), tagk, Region, operatingSystem, "^.*$", "Linux")

sources.sourceDescription: Multiply the number of reservations of each type by the hourly price savings for that reservation and the number of hours in a month
sources.name: monthly savings

charts.name: Unattained Savings per/month
charts.description: This chart show the difference in savings between the recommended number of instances to reserve (according to the current Estimation Approach Dashboard variable) and the actual number of reserved instances

sources.sourceDescription: aws.reservedInstance.count is a metric which reports the number of instances in each region. It has tags for instanceType, Region and AvailabilityZone (among others). Here we are interested in how many instances of each type have been reserved in each Region so we sum the metric grouping by those tags. Uses taggify to assume the operatingSystem is Linux
sources.name: reservations
sources.query: taggify(sum(align(5m, mean, ts(aws.reservedInstance.count)), instanceType, Region), tagk, Region, operatingSystem, "^.*$", "Linux")

sources.sourceDescription: Multiply the number of reservations of each type by the hourly price savings for that reservation and the number of hours in a month
sources.name: monthly savings

offering.label: Offering Type
offering.queryValue: retainSeries(taggify(align(5m, mean, last(ts(~sample.aws.ec2.reserved.price.hourly, source="us west (oregon)" and instanceType=t2.micro and operatingSystem=Linux))), tagk, leaseContractLength, length, "([1,3])yr", "$1"), length=${length})

purchaseOption.label: Purchase Option
purchaseOption.queryValue: retainSeries(taggify(align(5m, mean, last(ts(~sample.aws.ec2.reserved.price.hourly, source="us west (oregon)" and instanceType=t2.micro and operatingSystem=Linux and offeringClass="${offering}"))), tagk, leaseContractLength, length, "([1,3])yr", "$1"), length=${length})

valuesToReadableStrings.Label: avg(align(5m, mean, last(2h, ${upfront} + ${hourly})), instanceType, Region, operatingSystem)
